newsitem.title: JAPAN: Microsoft unveils Japanese version of Windows CE.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft unveils Japanese version of Windows CE.

text.p: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday unveiled the Japanese version of the Windows CE operating system for handheld personal computers.

The Japanese version of Windows CE, built for use in non-desktop handheld devices and mobile computing, will run on the new line of handheld computers unveiled by Japanese computer manufacturers NEC Corp and Casio Computer Co Ltd.
The English version was launched in the United States in November last year, Microsoft said in a statement.

NEC Corp separately announced on Wednesday that it would introduce new models of hand-held computers which run on the Japanese version of Windows CE. NEC's MC-CS11 will be launched on July 18 and is priced at 73,000 yen. The other model, MC-CS12, will be put on the market on August 28 and is priced at 89,000 yen.
Casio also unveiled similar hand-held computers which feature the Japanese version of Windows CE.
Casio's Cassiopeia A-50 will be priced at 75,000 yen and A-51 at 88,000 yen, and will be on sale from July 10, the company said on Wednesday. -- Tokyo Equities Desk +81-3-3432-9404
